dashboard.devices.edit.title: Configure device
dashboard.devices.new.step1.name: Device name
dashboard.devices.edit.sensors.empty: You haven't added any sensors yet.
dashboard.device.edit.instructions:
Configured sensors will be shown here. But if a device is reconfigured or you believe it sends messages while this page doesn't show anything, refresh the page.
                  Any MQTT messages sent to {topic} at {host}:{port} will appear in different sections below.
dashboard.device.edit.not_registered_sen: We have found some sensors that can be connected to this device. After connecting, you can assign the sensor to users.
dashboard.device.edit.not_connected_sens: These sensors are not connected to the broker. Please check connection and configuration on the device. They appear here because they were connected.
dashboard.devices.index.unconnected_noti: Notice: your devices {names} are not connected. Continue to connect instead of creating a new one?
dashboard.devices.edit_credentials.title: Credentials
dashboard.device.edit_credentials.instru:
You can reconfigure device's credentials. Existing connections will still works until they reconnect to us.
                        Now the key has {bytes} ({chars} characters).
                        We know that ESP32 only supports 32 bytes (64 characters) key.
dashboard.devices.edit.dialog.title: Remove device {name}?
dashboard.devices.edit.dialog.content: After removing device, we will no longer track devices and its sensor from MQTT.

dashboard.index.users.title: Users
dashboard.mqtt_logs.index.title: MQTT Logs
dashboard.devices.new.title: Connect with a new device
dashboard.devices.new.step1.unconnected_: Notice: your device {name} is not connected. Continue to connect instead of create a new one?
dashboard.devices.new.step1.notice:
We create a pre-shared key (PSK) for your new device and install it in our MQTT broker.
                  Be aware of your device's supported key length.
                  When your device connects with the broker with this key, you can add its sensor in the dashboard.
                  Registered and unused devices are shown on the devices page.
dashboard.devices.new.step2.title: Connect with a new device
dashboard.devices.new.errors.loading_err: We can not find your device. Please try to add your new device again.
We can not find your device {name}. Please try later.
dashboard.devices.new.step2.notice:
Now you can copy the key to your device and start to connect with the broker.
                  Once we receive a new message from the broker, we will prompt you to continue.
                  Your device's name is {name} (PSK identity).
                  Your device's key (PSK key) is shown below. Now the key has {bytes} ({chars} characters).
                  We know that ESP32 only supports 32 bytes (64 characters) key.
                  {code}
                  Please send messages via MQTT to {topic} at {host}:{port}.
dashboard.devices.new.step3.title: Connect with sensors for the device
dashboard.devices.new.errors.something_w: Something is wrong. We can't continue.
dashboard.devices.new.step3.notice: The device is now installed. You can start to connect sensors. You can also add sensors in the device details page later.
dashboard.devices.new.step1.label: Create a key
dashboard.devices.new.step2.label: Install and connect
dashboard.devices.new.step3.label: Add sensors
dashboard.sensors.assign.title: Who can see {name}?
dashboard.sensors.assign.instructions: You can configure who can see this sensor. All administators can see this sensor.
dashboard.sensors.index.title: Sensors
dashboard.devices.edit.removal_dialog.co: After removing sensor, all existing data are cleard and we will no longer track values from MQTT.
dashboard.users.index.title: Users
dashboard.users.index.delete.title: Delete account {name}?
dashboard.users.index.delete.instruction: Delete the user will disable its access to the system. And this may result in unexpected behaviour.
